Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
The JBL Tune 510BT wireless on-ear headphones with Purebass Sound are a remarkable audio companion that delivers an exceptional sound experience. Whether you're editing videos, listening to music, or simply enjoying your favorite audio content, these headphones provide a level of sound quality that is truly impressive.
One of the standout features of the JBL Tune 510BT is its ability to produce deep, rich bass. The Purebass Sound technology enhances the low-frequency response, resulting in a powerful and immersive audio experience. Whether you're listening to bass-heavy tracks or watching action-packed movies, the headphones deliver a satisfying thump that adds depth and excitement to your audio.
The overall sound quality is excellent across the frequency spectrum. The headphones offer a balanced sound signature, ensuring that both highs and mids are clear and detailed. This allows you to hear intricate details in your music or videos that you may have missed with other headphones. The audio is well-rounded and engaging, making it a joy to listen to a wide range of genres and content.
Comfort is another area where the JBL Tune 510BT excels. The on-ear design is lightweight and ergonomically designed to provide a comfortable fit for extended listening sessions. The ear cushions are soft and plush, allowing the headphones to sit comfortably on your ears without causing discomfort or fatigue. The adjustable headband ensures a secure fit, and the overall build quality feels durable and sturdy.
Being wireless, the JBL Tune 510BT offers the convenience of freedom from tangled cables. The Bluetooth connectivity allows for seamless pairing with your devices, and the wireless range is impressive, providing a stable connection even when you move around the room. The on-ear controls are intuitive and easy to use, allowing you to adjust the volume, play/pause music, and answer calls with just a few simple button presses.
Battery life is a crucial factor for wireless headphones, and the JBL Tune 510BT delivers in this aspect as well. With up to 40 hours of playtime on a single charge, you can enjoy your music for extended periods without worrying about running out of battery. This long-lasting battery life is particularly convenient for travel, commutes, or long work sessions.
The JBL Tune 510BT also features a built-in microphone, enabling hands-free calling. The call quality is clear, and the microphone effectively picks up your voice while minimizing background noise. This feature is especially useful when you need to take calls on the go without having to reach for your phone.
In terms of design, the JBL Tune 510BT strikes a balance between style and functionality. The sleek and modern look is appealing, and the foldable design allows for easy storage and portability. The headphones come with a carrying pouch, making it convenient to take them with you wherever you go.
In conclusion, the JBL Tune 510BT wireless on-ear headphones with Purebass Sound offer an outstanding audio experience. The sound quality is impressive, with deep bass and clear highs that bring your music and videos to life. The comfortable design ensures a pleasant fit, even during extended use, and the wireless functionality provides freedom and convenience. With its long battery life, built-in microphone, and stylish design, the JBL Tune 510BT is a fantastic choice for anyone seeking high-quality wireless headphones.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
JBL510BT
Great BT headphones with a little extra bass. Fantastic! These are light and comfortable. Also glasses friendly since the ear pads are smaller.
Many have asked online how these compare to the JBL710BT, but I haven't found any clear opinions. I have the JBL710BT and the JBL510BT, and I took the time to compare the feel and sound of these.
The mids and highs of the 510 and 710 are very similar and hard to tell apart. The biggest difference is the bass. Despite the smaller drivers, the 510 has enhanced bass and a higher max volume. Usually this is great and works well with "normal" balanced music. Songs with heavy bass, sometimes it is a little too much.
The 510 is wireless only. The 710 also has a cable, if you want/need to connect this way -- and it sounds just as good without power.
The 710 is a bit larger and heavier. The larger ear pads block out more ambient noise than the smaller 510.
Both models are great BT headphones. They are as good as other name brands.
I recommend the 510 because of the light weight and higher max volume.
-Chris

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I’m not a headphone connoisseur but for my everyday life these are perfect! My AirPods gave out after a couple of years and I wanted to try over the head studio headphones. I talked myself down from spending 100s of dollars on beats and gave these a try. These are perfect to me! I wear headphones all the time while cleaning, while working, even for my sounds while I sleep occasionally. I go to the gym maybe 4 times a week and I use headphones then as well. These headphones have checked all of those boxes flawlessly. They aren’t tight on my head like other reviews have stated and the pad around the ears makes them very comfortable. They also don’t slip and slide all over the place. A pretty nice fit! But that battery life though!! I charge these when I remember, which is maybe once a week. After using them sun up to sun down they have never died on me. I was also skeptical about the color because I didn’t want them to stain but the color seems to be holding up well. I lay these things anywhere and they haven’t tarnished as far as I can see. There is a clicking noise that is pretty faint. I only hear it when I have them on and nothing is playing. To me, that is a drop in the bucket and nothing to fret about because these are pretty darn good headphones. They aren’t just good for the price these are good PERIOD! This is a great buy! Oh and the sound quality which is a pretty important aspect to mention is fantastic. I would say it definitely rivals my AirPods. Especially watching a movie or tv show, the sound quality immerses you like a surround sound theater.

Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
Got a great price thru a Black Friday deal. Wanted them as a more comfortable alternative to my beats earbuds, and these do the job. The unit has good sound quality and is easy to use, but some of the build features seem destined to fail.
First, the swivel on the individual cans is dependent on a very narrow plastic, presumably hollow (how else would the wires be run?) pin. Care should be taken not to over-rotate the cans and stress/fatigue the pin. The other thing I wasn’t crazy about is the material (pleather?) used on the padding. It feels EXTREMELY thin and I anticipate it tearing quite easily. I worry abt transport or even adjusting while wearing.
Performance is good, esp’ly when considering the value. All of the controls (Vol & pairing) are intuitive even while wearing/using once one familiarizes themselves with their placement. They’re on the R can, so just be aware if you’re a lefty. Definitely more function than form - the design of the unit is quite plain, which suits me just fine.
Aside from babying the unit to avoid tearing the padding material or breaking the swivel on the cans, I anticipate being happy with these.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
These are a solid set of headphones 🎧
And they sound great for the price point, I wasn't expecting them to sound this good actually, so I'm pleasantly surprised.
It has a solid base but its not going to knock you out of your shoes, lol....great midrange and vocals, and a nice quiet background. And not being tech savvy at all, straight out of the box I got them connected, super simple plug and play! Volume control fast forward to the next song taking calls etc work seamlessly..Thank God for that lol
And they have a comfortable fit on your head and ears at least for me..
You really can't go wrong with JBL, they make a great product and for this price it's a great buy. Get yourself a pair while this price lasts. You won't be disappointed I guarantee it.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
This is my first pair of BT headphones for listening pleasure (I own a few pairs of single ear BT headphones for at home work). Let me tell y'all - the way it made my music sound puts other headphones to SHAME.
I've only had these a few weeks, but they were easy to set up and easy to operate. I gave it 5 Stars for Noise Cancellation even though they didn't claim to be, and here's why: The on-ear design naturally cancels out ALL noise!
I live in NYC and, honestly, in order to be aware of my surroundings while on the subway, I HAVE to pull the headphones slightly off my ear - or I won't hear ANYTHING outside of my music!  I don't know how long the battery lasts because - quite frankly - the battery has NEVER run out on me (and I've had it running for 3 hours at one point!).
The ONLY thing that makes me mad about this headset is that I purchased it when it was nearly 50% off and FAILED to get another set before it went back to its' original price of $50. Still, even at THAT price point, this headset is DEFINITELY worth every penny.
I HIGHLY recommend it!

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: Just got these today and absolutely love them! They didn’t take long to charge at all and are still at 100% charge. I have a small head and ears so the shortest setting the head band can go is perfect for me, the headphone part is smaller than most headphones but for me is a perfect size, will not slip off my head. The audio quality is far superior than AirPods, the bass is amazing. I have the audio up load and when wearing no one can hear your music unless they’re right up to your face. Noise canceling is good I can barely hear anything around me with the music on. The middle button to accept an incoming call works great! I can hear the other person on the line just fine, Bluetooth was super easy to connect as well. Over all super satisfied with these especially for the price, I highly advise getting them if you’re looking for great headphones for the gym, working on the computer, working outside or whatever! And love the pink color if you want to pink ones, they’re definitely a soft pink but super cute

Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review:
I bought this headset in a hurry to allow my dad to watch videos during a hospital stay. I wanted a headset that was durable, comfortable, reliable, easy to adjust to different head sizes, would partly block sounds in his shared room, and was relatively inexpensive in case it got lost. These headphones met all those requirements and I can highly recommend them for listening to streaming videos.
My only reservation is that the sound quality is not good enough for music. I used them on a long plane flight and found the sound quality to be fair to poor with a wide range of recordings with which I’m familiar. I’m a bit of an audiophile and these headphones were relatively inexpensive, so I wasn’t surprised and you shouldn’t hold that too much against them. They are durable, reliable, comfortable - and have really long battery life.

Title: 5.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I'm a huge fan of JBL speakers, always have been. I've had the Charge 3 for a while now and it's just awesome. I used to have skullcandy headphones and would never part with them, until they broke anyway. I found these on sale and figured I'd try them, I already have the portable, why not headphones? I'm super pleased with these headphones. They look fly, connected to my phone in a flash, and the sound is comparable to my old skullcandys. They sit nicely on my ears so they're pretty comfortable to wear too. They charged really fast as I used them most of the evening after they got to me. A case would be nice as I'm paranoid of getting these dirty. Overall you can't go wrong with this set of headphones. They sound great, comfortable to wear, easy to use, and look amazing too!

Title: 4.0 out of 5 stars
Review: I'll make this brief. If you're in the market for headphones, these are no-brainers at 50% off. Sound is excellent and can be tweaked through an equalizer app and battery life is fantastic. The one constant negative I've read is that the headband is too small. Well, I have a big head (no jokes please) and found the fit comfortable enough. The earpad don't enclose the ear but fit snugly against the ears without pressing too tight. In fact, I've found them comfortable enough that I sleep in them. I live in a very noisy environment and am a light sleeper to boot. Shutting out outside sounds is critical to being able to fall asleep for any length of time. I've used the headbands with speakers, but the headphones are better at blocking out sound, and pairing them  with a YouTube submarine engine sound video effectively blocks out the outside world and puts me deep under the sea. I sleep like a baby since I've gotten these. For $25 bucks, you're not going to get better sound.
